formalpara.title: Figure 1: Types of protein interactions and complexes:
formalpara.para: (A) obligate interactions, (B) condition-specific interactions, (C) transient complex between an enzyme and substrate representing transient interactions, (D) a DNA-bound protein representing protein complexes that are part of large macromolecular structures, and (E) “complex isoforms” or “complexoforms” containing cores, modules, and attachments (Adapted from Gavin et al., 2006) as combinations of obligate, condition-specific, and transient interactions.
